objectives.en: To provide students with a clear understanding of ICT related legal issues in the fields of e-commerce, IT contracts, and consumer law. To prepare students to critically analyse and plan legal strategies for e-commerce as well as handle claims related to consumer protection, information society services and online sales.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda tudengitele selge arusaam IKT-ga seotud õigusprobleemidest e-kaubanduse, IT lepingute ning tarbijaõiguste valdkonnas. Tudengeid valmistatakse ette õiguslike strateegiate kriitiliseks analüüsiks ja planeerimiseks e-kaubanduses; samuti tarbijakaitse, infoühiskonna teenuste ja internetikaubandusega seotud nõuete menetlemiseks.

objectives.en: In this regard, it focuses on
1. analysing and formulating contracts related to the development and uses of ICTs, and
objectives.et: 1. IKT-de arenduse ja kasutusega seotud lepingute analüüsile ja koostamisele; ja

objectives.en: 2. mapping the main types of online transactions to applicable legal regimes under international law, regional legal instruments and local regulation (taking into account the interaction between domestic and international law in this field).
objectives.et: 2. põhiliste internetitehingutüüpide kaardistamisele kohalduvate õiguslike režiimide järgi rahvusvahelise õiguse, regionaalsete õigusaktide ja kohalike regulatsioonide alusel (võttes arvesse riigisisese ja rahvusvahelise õiguse vastastikust mõju selles valdkonnas).

learning_outcomes.en: * know which documentation must be present on an e-commerce website and have the skills to draft the general terms and conditions.
learning_outcomes.et: * teavad, millist tüüpi dokumentatsioon peab e-kaubandusega tegeleval veebilehel olema ning neil on lepingu üldtingimuste koostamise oskused;

learning_outcomes.en: * have the knowledge of what to keep in mind when drafting and negotiating IT contracts, including licensing, outsourcing and other technology related agreements.
learning_outcomes.et: * teavad, mida IT lepingute koostamisel ja nendega seotud läbirääkimistel meeles pidada, sh litsentsimine, teenuste sisseostmine ning muud tehnoloogiaga seotud lepingud;

learning_outcomes.en: * be able to contractually manage risks related to development and uses of ICT
learning_outcomes.et: * on võimelised lepinguliselt haldama IKT arenduse ja kasutusega seotud riske;

learning_outcomes.en: * create and analyse e-commerce strategies and legal e-business strategies
learning_outcomes.et: * loovad ja analüüsivad e-kaubanduse strateegiaid ja e-ettevõtluse õiguslikke strateegiaid;

learning_outcomes.en: * be familiar with the legal and technical aspects of IT related public procurements
learning_outcomes.et: * on tuttavad IT-ga seotud riigihangete õiguslike ja tehniliste aspektidega;

learning_outcomes.en: * know problems in the use of electronic signatures in practise regarding concluding transactions;
learning_outcomes.et: * teavad elektrooniliste allkirjade kasutamise probleemidest praktikas tehingute sõlmimisel;

learning_outcomes.en: * be familiar with the regulation of information society services;
* know terms and main legal acts related to Blockchain and  virtual and crypto currency.
learning_outcomes.et: * teavad Blockchain'i, krüptorahaga seotud mõisteid ja peamisi õigusakte ning õiguslikke probleeme.

independent_work.et:
(i) drafting the text of an agreement
(ii) analysing a contract and/or standard terms
(iii) drafting a legal memo

description.et:
ASSESSMENT CRITERIA

The individual work can get up to a total of 100 points, which correspond to the following scores:
91-100 points - A
81-90 points - B
71-80 points - C
61-70 points - D
51-60 points - E
0-50 points - F.

3. Every delayed day in submitting homework will result in the deduction of 5 points.

grade_evaluation.et:
The course consists of two parts: E-Commerce and IT Contracts.

Students must work through the prescribed literature and tasks in order to prepare for lectures and seminars. Knowledge of the materials and the solutions of the tasks will be verified during the discussions held in the courses and seminars.
Individual work must be performed for both parts of the course in addition to attending lectures and seminars and working through the prescribed literature.
The objective of the individual work is to provide an assessment concerning the student's progress in the course.

Differentiated assessment will apply to individual work. The grade for the course will be formed of two components:
1. the two pieces of individual work to be performed within the framework of part E-Commerce of the course - 50% and
2. the two pieces of individual work to be performed within the framework of part IT-Contracts of the course - 50%.

Students must achieve at least 51% of the maximum grade in both parts of the course in order to pass. The individual work can get up to a total of 100 points.
A negative result in one part of the course will result in a negative total grade. A negative grade in one part of the course will not prevent passing the second part of the course.

debt_elimination.et: According to the Study Regulations (Õppekorralduseeskiri). Students will be able to pass a re-examination in order to improve a negative grade only for the part of the course that they failed to pass. The results of the re-examination will be added to the points for the part of the course that the students passed.
